did.abstract: The Pennyroyal Press was established in 1976 by Barry Moser to publish his illustrated books. The Pennyroyal Press Records spans the years 1970-1988. The collection is divided into four series—Pennyroyal Press Records, Barry Moser papers, Hampshire Typothetae records, and Miscellany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Pennyroyal Press Records spans the years 1970-1988. The collection is divided into four series—Pennyroyal Press Records, Barry Moser papers, Hampshire Typothetae records, and Miscellany. The records of the Pennyroyal Press include the business, legal and production papers for books designed by Barry Moser that were printed at the Hampshire Typothetae. They include: Frankenstein, Alice in Wonderland, Through the Looking Glass, The Wizard of Oz, Huckleberry Finn, Richard Yarde's Savoy, Moby Dick, Dante, Anne Frank, Artic Whaling, Red Badge of Courage, and Scarlet Letter. There are also general business, financial and legal papers of the Press. The Barry Moser papers include correspondence and general personal papers, sketches, news clippings, contracts, commissions, business papers and examples of the presswork of Harold P. McGrath of an ephemeral nature including the job tickets (called job bags by McGrath), as well as correspondence and business and financial papers. There are 22 framed posters, broadsides and page spreads from books, 2 oil paintings and numerous pieces of ephemera. Also included are papers related to Pioneer Publishing (1984), that was an attempt to raise money for further printing, and papers related to Jeffrey P. Dwyer's various bookstores: Hadley Bookshop (1972); Dwyer Bookshop (1972-1974).

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Pennyroyal Press was established in 1976 by Barry Moser to publish his illustrated books. In 1978, Moser, Harold P. McGrath, Jeffrey P. Dwyer, John Lancaster, Ruth Mortimer, and John Locke established the Hampshire Typothetae in Northampton, Massachusetts (later in West Hatfield, Massachusetts). This business was established using letterpress printing equipment that Leonard Baskin had used at his Gehenna Press, McGrath had been Baskin's printer. The Typothetae operated until 1986 when the equipment was sold to Alan James Robinson of Easthampton. McGrath worked for Robinson until shortly before his death in 2000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I contains business, production, and legal papers from book projects as well as general Pennyroyal Press business correspondence, business and financial papers, and legal papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 2 contains artwork, correspondence, and the personal papers of Barry Moser.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 3 contains job tickets, production material, and general Hampshire Typothetae business papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 4 contains papers from Pioneer Publishing, the Northampton Group, Dwyers's businesses as well as photographs and framed pieces.
